title: Can your client not fucking demand my attention for 2 seconds?
body: Seriously, why does League need to tab me out of other programs 8 fucking times? What's the point of having sounds for the alerts? Like seriously, god fucking forbid I try to play ANYTHING ELSE while I wait for a fucking game.

i've had this same issue, it's an annoying fix, but clicking on the league client icon in the task bar itself always has worked for me. you can't click on the other application icons or inside of the other applications themselves, you have to click the league icon down on the taskbar as if to minimize it. maybe you're having a different issue from me, but that's historically worked for me.

you can also press windows logo key (also referred to as the super key) and the D key to minimize everything so that you can click on what you want to view

My personal favorite is how the window pops up in front of everything but doesn't actually take cursor focus.

Taking focus when a queue pops is fine. Queues can take several minutes, so people often do something else during that time with the expectation that they will be alerted. When a queue pops, you only have a few seconds to act. It makes sense to take focus in this case.

However, the other half dozen times the client is programmed to take focus are absolutely unnecessary. If someone has accepted a match, they are well aware that they will soon be put into champ select. If they alt-tab at that time, it stands to reason that they are doing so with the knowledge that they are currently in champ select. There's no need to set focus back to the client on basically every event a few seconds apart. If Riot released a public API to enable third-party clients, someone might actually make a good one.
